s.text: Wait, sorry, excuse me--as it turns out, no, they don't.

AG (from under the covers): What I hear you saying is that anyone who talks about how important it is for families to stay together and be strong ought to also be supportive of families in this situation.

But just as most comic book readers move on to other forms of literature (despite Art Spiegelman's unconvincing plea that "they're really illustrated novels"), most voters in a mature democracy demand more from candidates than a packaged personality and a glib slogan.

But just as most comic book readers move on to other forms of literature (despite Art Spiegelman's unconvincing plea that "they're really illustrated novels"), most voters in a mature democracy demand more from candidates than a packaged personality and a glib slogan.
Because you're a man and you come forward and you can help so many men.
